stone.util

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • stone.util.Path
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Path>

    public final class Path
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Path>, java.io.Externalizable
    Represents paths relative to a certain base or absolute, specified by FileSystem.
    Author:
    Nelphindal
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getDataDirectory

        Returns:
        parsed Path of FileSystem.getDataDirectory()

      • getPath

        public static final Path getPath(java.lang.String... name)
        Parses the given string name and returns a path representing the corresponding path. The resulting path will be separated resulting to given name on its array components.
        Parameters:
        name - components of path to create
        Returns:
        the parsed path

      • getPath

        public static final Path getPath(java.net.URL url)
        Parses the given url url and returns a path representing the corresponding path.
        Parameters:
        url - URL to parse. leading jar: and file: will be truncated.
        Returns:
        the parsed path

      • getTmpDirOrFile

        public static final Path getTmpDirOrFile(java.lang.String prefix)
        Creates an unused path, and marks the associated file for deletion on exit
        Parameters:
        prefix - prefix of created temporary directory
        Returns:
        a path usable for a temporary directory

      • readExternal

        public static final Path readExternal(java.io.InputStream in)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Reads from given InputStream and generates the resulting Path object.
        Parameters:
        in - InputStream to read from. The stream my contain only one encoded Path object.
        Returns:
        parsed Path
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception thrown by in

      • readExternals

        public static final java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Path> readExternals(java.io.InputStream in)
                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads from given InputStream and generates the resulting Path object.
        Parameters:
        in - InputStream to read from. The stream my contain only encoded Path objects with leading bytes for encoded Integer to use for the map key.
        Returns:
        parsed Map of Integer and Path objects
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception thrown by in

      • delete

        public final boolean delete()
        Deletes the file matching to this path relative to the base. The wholte directory will be delelted if this path is pointing to a directory.
        Returns:
        true if the file was deleted
        See Also:
        File.delete()

        Checks if the the file where this path points to exists.
        Returns:
        true if the the file where this path points to exists

      • getBaseName

        public final java.lang.String getBaseName()
        Returns the name of the first directory specified by this path. "/foo/bar" would be return "foo" for example.
        Returns:
        null if this is a base.

      • getComponentAt

        public final java.lang.String getComponentAt(int layer)
        Parameters:
        layer - the n-th component of this Path object
        Returns:
        the part of this path

      • getFilename

        public final java.lang.String getFilename()
        Returns the last part of this path. "/foo/bar" would be return "bar" for example.
        Returns:
        the last part of this path.

      • getNameCount

        public final int getNameCount()
        Returns the number of components of this path. "/" will return 0 and "/foo/bar" will return 2.
        Returns:
        the number of components of this path

      • getParent

        public final Path getParent()
        Returns the parent of this path. "/" will return null and "/foo/bar" will return "/foo".
        Returns:
        the parent

        public final int hashCode()
        Overrides:

        public final java.lang.String relativize(Path base)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the string for which base.resolve() would return this

      • renameTo

        public final boolean renameTo(Path pathNew)
        Renames the file this path is pointing to to where pathNew points to. If this path is a directory all contained files will be renamed recursively.
        Parameters:
        pathNew - path pointing to the new location
        Returns:
        true if renaming was successful
        See Also:
        File.renameTo(File)

      • resolve

        public final Path resolve(java.lang.String name)
        Concatenates two paths. name will be parsed and appended to this path. For example "/foo".resolve("/bar") will return "/foo/bar".
        Parameters:
        name - path to append
        Returns:
        the concatenated path

      • resolve

        public final Path resolve(java.lang.String... name)
        Concatenates two paths. name will be parsed and appended to this path. For example "/foo".resolve("/bar") will return "/foo/bar".
        Parameters:
        name - path to append
        Returns:
        the concatenated path

      • writeExternals

        public final void writeExternals(Path.PathAwareObjectOutput out)
        Writes this object embedded into a stream mapping a file hierarchy. The resulting output can be parsed back by readExternals(InputStream).
        Parameters:
        out - instance of Path.PathAwareObjectOutput taking care of creating the output
